meanings.definition: To dial a telephone number again.
meanings.sent1: I had to redial the number because I dialed it wrong the first time.
meanings.sent2: She quickly redialed the number to make sure she got through.
meanings.sent3: After several failed attempts, he finally decided to redial the number with more focus.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to reach her friend was so strong that she could almost feel the need to redial in her fingertips.
meanings.sent5: The urgency of the situation made him redial the emergency number without hesitation.

meanings.definition: The act of redialing a telephone number.
meanings.sent1: His constant redial of the number annoyed everyone in the office.
meanings.sent2: The redial of the emergency line was necessary to ensure help arrived on time.
meanings.sent3: The repeated redial of the wrong number made him realize his mistake.
meanings.sent4: The redial of the customer service line felt like a never-ending loop of waiting.
meanings.sent5: The redial of the missed call brought relief when she finally got through.
